alert.note: Alert for Matagorda; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:49PM CDT until May 15 at 8:54PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Tres Palacios River near Midfield affecting Matagorda and Wharton Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. .Additional rainfall is possible which could lead to increases in stage levels. For the Tres Palacios River...including Midfield...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tres Palacios River near Midfield. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with water well into the flood plain on the right upstream bank and within inches of spilling over the east approach to the bridge at FM 456. The river will be almost one quarter mile wide in the vicinity of the gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 25.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM CDT Sunday was 25.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.4 feet on 03/12/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Tres Palacios River Midfield 24.0 25.5 Sun 2 pm CDT 22.5 16.2 10.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CDT.
